ggcommonality 1.0.0
  • Reference

    Object for plotting commonality analyses

    ggcommonality.Rd

    Object for plotting commonality analyses

    ggcommonality(
  formula,
  data,
  add_ci = TRUE,
  stack = FALSE,
  stack_by = "common",
  n_replications = 100,
  sample_column = NULL,
  resample_type = "wild",
  wild_type = "gaussian",
  include_total = FALSE,
  seed = NULL
)

    Arguments

    formula

    Formula in form of y ~ x1 + x2

    data

    Data.frame object containing data to be visualized

    add_ci

    Logical. Add bootstrap-estimated confidence interval?

    stack

    Logical. Stack commonality effects?

    stack_by

    Character. Either "common" to stack unique vs. common effects or "partition" to stack unique and common effects for each IV.

    n_replications

    Numeric. Number of replications for bootstrap simulation.

    sample_column

    Character. Name of column to perform stratified sampling with, or leave as NULL

    resample_type

    Character. Method for boostrap resampling. Either "random", "fixed", or "wild". See README for details.

    wild_type

    Character. If resample_type == "wild", either "Gaussian" to multiply resampled residuals by random constants from the normal distribution, or sign to randomly multiply half of the residuals by +1 and half by -1. This provides a solution to "fixed" in the presence of model heteroscedasticity. See README for details

    include_total

    Logical. Include bar representing total variance explained across all unique and common effects?

    seed

    Numeric. Number to set R's randomization seed to (for reproducibility).

    Contents

    Developed by Cameron J. Anderson, Michael Schutz.
